column2: CONNECTICUT DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column6: CT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column6: keep a constant speed.
column8: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 2. A steady yellow light means:
column6: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 3. As your speed increases it is most important to:
column4: drive with both hands on steering wheel.
column6: look farther ahead.
column8: maintain a constant speed.

column2: 4. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: signal your return to the left lane.
column6: sound your horn as you pass.
column8: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.

column2: 5. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column6: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: avoid drinking coffee.

column2: 6. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column6: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column8: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 7. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column6: right turns are not allowed.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 8. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column6: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 9. This is:
column6: a side road sign.
column8: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 10. A yellow arrow means:
column4: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column6: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 11. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
column6: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
column8: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.

column2: 12. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: cross the tracks.
column8: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column6: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column8: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.

column2: 14. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column6: make a U-turn.
column8: look for a detour or another route.

column2: 15. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column6: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column8: stay focused on the center line on the road.

column2: 16. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.

column2: 17. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
column6: 0.15% or more.
column8: 0.08% or more.

column2: 18. Vehicles stopped behind a school bus when the red lights are flashing must remain stopped until:
column6: all students are off the bus.
column8: the stop arm is retracted and the bus begins moving.

column2: 19. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column6: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column8: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 20. This sign indicates that:
column6: there is a steep hill ahead.
column8: trucks are merging from the right

column2: 21. This sign means:
column6: Hairpin corner ahead.
column8: Sharp right turn ahead.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: Slippery when wet
column8: Winding road

column2: 23. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: if it’s raining.
column8: BEFORE you move.

column2: 24. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column6: scan the road ahead for hazards.
column8: pump your brakes to make sure they work.

column2: 25. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column6: are less important than
column8: must obey
